getOrAnswers

public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getOrAnswers(java.lang.String answer)
Parameters:
answer - Answer's feedback attribute
Returns:
List of groups of answers separated by , (the OR operator)

getAndAnswers

public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAndAnswers(java.lang.String orAnswer)
Parameters:
orAnswer - One of the groups of answers returned by 'getOrAnswers'
Returns:
List of answers separated by + (the AND operator)

isAnswerFlagNot

public static boolean isAnswerFlagNot(java.lang.String andAnswer)
Parameters:
andAnswer - One of the answers returned by 'getAndAnswers'
Returns:
true if the answer is negated by ! (the NOT operator)

decrementOmIdsOfFeedbackAnswer

public static java.lang.String decrementOmIdsOfFeedbackAnswer(java.lang.String answer,
                                                              int position)
Decrement all OM answer components identifiers above given position inside the string received.

It is useful when we delete an answer to update anwers's feedbacks attributes because we decrement positions of some answers components identifiers and we need to apply these changes also to them.

Parameters:
answer - Answer's feedback attribute
position - Removed position
Returns:
Same string with all OM answer components identifiers above given position decremented

splitButNotInsideSelectors

public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> splitButNotInsideSelectors(java.lang.String s,
                                                                          char separator,
                                                                          java.util.Map<java.lang.Character,java.lang.String> escapeSequences)
Split a string by a separator character but without splitting selectors, even if they contain separator characters.

It also takes care of escape sequences.

Parameters:
s - String
separator - Separator character
escapeSequences - Map with the escape sequences
Returns:
List of splitted strings

endWithSequenceEscapeCharacter

public static boolean endWithSequenceEscapeCharacter(java.lang.String s,
                                                     java.util.Map<java.lang.Character,java.lang.String> escapeSequences)
Checks if the last character of the string is the escape sequence character, taking account other possible sequence escapes.

Parameters:
s - String
escapeSequences - Map with the escape sequences
Returns:
true if the last character of the string is the escape sequence character, false otherwise

getOnlyId

public static java.lang.String getOnlyId(java.lang.String idAnswer)
Parameters:
idAnswer - Identifier of component selected for answer (including answer selector if exists)
Returns:
Same identifier but without selector

getAnswerSelector

public static java.lang.String getAnswerSelector(java.lang.String idAnswer)
Gets attribute's selector if defined, otherwise return null.

Note that there are availabe some escape sequences in the attribute's selector:
Escape sequenceReplaced character
\,,
\??
\::
\[[
\]]
\nNew line character
\((
\))
\{{
\}}
\!!
\##
\&&
\""
\\\

Returns:
Attribute's selector if defined, null otherwise

indexOfCharacter

public static int indexOfCharacter(java.lang.String s,
                                   char ch,
                                   java.util.Map<java.lang.Character,java.lang.String> escapeSequences)
Get the index of a character in the string taking care of escape sequences.

Parameters:
s - String
ch - Character to search
escapeSequences - Map with the escape sequences
Returns:
Index of a character in the string taking care of escape sequences or -1 if it is not found

indexOfCharacter

public static int indexOfCharacter(java.lang.String s,
                                   char ch,
                                   int fromIndex,
                                   java.util.Map<java.lang.Character,java.lang.String> escapeSequences)
Get the index of a character in the string from the indicated index taking care of escape sequences.

Parameters:
s - String
ch - Character to search
fromIndex - Index of character in the string from which we start the search
escapeSequences - Map with the escape sequences
Returns:
Index of a character in the string from the indicated index taking care of escape sequences or -1 if it is not found

getEscapeSequences

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.Character,java.lang.String> getEscapeSequences()
Get a map with the following escape sequences:
Escape sequenceReplaced character
\,,
\..
\??
\::
\[[
\]]
\nNew line character
\((
\))
\{{
\}}
\!!
\##
\&&
\""
\\\

Returns:
Map with escape sequences
